page.title: 04ASHDON PRIMARY SCHOOL.
page.content: {Ashdon}County Primary School was opened on the 30th September 1878 ultimately replacing the National School which had opened its doors in 1853 and now stands empty at the top of Church Hill.The number of pupils on roll has varied between 35 on the opening day to 135 pupils in 1906.For the last 7 or 8 years the number of classes have been 3 and the number of pupils on roll has consistently been between 60 and 70.In 1972 the old Victorian premises were extended and extensively modernised.Two open_plan infant classrooms and a quiet room were added to the 2 existing ones.An assembly hall with separate dining area and modern kitchen was also included in the new development.The school caters for children between the ages of 5 and 11 years and serves the 2 parishes of Ashdon and Hadstock.
